senses.de: A choice or possibilities from which you can choose.
senses.ex: We have a few options for dinner tonight: pizza, tacos, or spaghetti.

Tips.title: Weighing Choices
Tips.description: Consider different aspects or consequences before making a decision between options.
Tips.example: Take your time to weigh your options for college.

Tips.title: Not Permanent
Tips.description: An option implies flexibility; it is not a final or fixed choice.
Tips.example: Choosing a major isn't final; you have the option to change it later.

senses.de: In business world, it is a contract giving the holder the right to buy or sell a stock at a specified price within a certain time period.
senses.ex: He bought an option to purchase 500 shares of the company's stock.

Tips.title: Financial Decisions
Tips.description: Options in finance come with a potential risk or gain, requiring careful assessment.
Tips.example: He exercised his stock options when the market price was high.

Tips.title: Time Sensitive
Tips.description: Financial options have an expiration date by which you must decide to use them or lose them.
Tips.example: Her put options expire next month, so she needs to act soon.

senses.de: In sports, it is a play in which the player with the ball can either run with it or pass it.
senses.ex: The quarterback decided to keep the ball and run it himself instead of using the option play.

Tips.title: Tactical Flexibility
Tips.description: In sports, an 'option' play provides the player with immediate choices based on the opposing team's actions.
Tips.example: The team often uses the run option to surprise their opponents.

Tips.title: Game Context
Tips.description: The success of a sports 'option' often depends on the specific context and dynamics of the game.
Tips.example: Facing a strong defense, he went for the pass option.

senses.de: In computing, it is a choice you can select on a digital screen or program.
senses.ex: Click on the 'File' menu at the top of the screen and select the 'Save' option.

Tips.title: Digital Choices
Tips.description: Computing options are often found in menus or settings and selecting one can change how a program operates.
Tips.example: She selected the 'color inversion' option to ease her reading experience.

Tips.title: User Control
Tips.description: Options in computing empower users by letting them customize their experience according to their preferences.
Tips.example: He turned off the 'autosave' option to manually control when his document is saved.

Alternative.wordDefinition:
Alternative refers to one of the many options offered. It's another way to describe a choice that is different from the norm.

For example, someone might choose to pursue an alternative therapy treatment instead of undergoing traditional medical treatment.

In simpler terms, option is the set of choices given while alternative is one of the choices offered.

Choice.wordDefinition:
The words choice and option both refer to the act of selecting between two or more things.

However, choice usually implies a decision that involves personal preference or free will, while option suggests an available alternative without the connotation of personal preference.

For example, if someone asked you what you wanted to eat for dinner, and you answered "I have no choice but to eat broccoli," the word choice implies that you don't want to eat broccoli but feel you have to.

If you instead answered "My options are broccoli or salad," the word option implies that you are only considering those two specific choices, but may not necessarily have a preference between them.

Choice is used when there is a personal preference involved, while option describes the available choices without the pressure of personal preference.

Decision.wordDefinition:
A decision is a choice that has been made after considering different options. An option is one of the choices available to make a decision.

In other words, a decision is the final choice that has been made, whereas an option is one of the alternatives that was considered before making the final decision.

For example, if you were trying to decide what to have for dinner, your options might include pizza, pasta, or salad. Once you choose pizza, that is your decision.

In summary, options are the alternatives you have when making a decision, and decisions are the final choices that have been made.

Election.wordDefinition:
Election refers to the process of choosing something or someone, often through voting.

Election is used when there is a formal decision that needs to be made, often involving a group of people or a larger society.

Opportunity.wordDefinition:
Opportunity means a chance or possibility to do something, especially something that you want to do. It often refers to a favorable or advantageous situation that presents itself.

The main difference between these words is that opportunity refers to a chance or possibility, while the option refers to a choice or alternative.

For example, if you were offered a job, it would be an opportunity because it presents a possibility for you to work in a new position.

Opportunity refers to a favorable circumstance, while an option is a range of choices available.

Possibility.wordDefinition:
Option refers to a choice we make from a set of alternatives or possibilities that are available to us. It means we have the power to decide which alternative we want to choose.

Possibility refers to a situation or circumstance that has the potential to happen or exist. It means that there is a chance or likelihood that something may happen or come into being.

If you are thinking about becoming a doctor, it is a possibility for you if you have the necessary qualifications and you work hard towards achieving your goal.

So, options are the choices we make, and possibilities are the chances or opportunities that exist for us.

Preference.wordDefinition:
Option refers to a choice that is available to someone, while preference refers to someone's favorite or most desired choice.

For example, if you go to a restaurant and the server asks if you want soup or salad, those are your options. If you choose salad, then salad is your preference.

Options are applicable when there are multiple choices available and you need to make a decision. Preferences are applicable when you have a specific favorite or desire.

Selection.wordDefinition:
Option refers to the range of choices available to someone, while the word selection is the actual choice made from those available options.

These are all "options." Once you decide what you want to eat - say, the chicken - that becomes your "selection."

Option refers to the possibilities available, while selection describes the specific choice made from those possibilities.

quotes.Text: Our most important task is to transform our consciousness so that violence is no longer an option for us in our personal lives, that understanding that a world of peace is possible only if we relate to each other as peaceful beings, one individual at a time.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.Text: Of course, health is the most important thing, but shutting down the entire economy for months is also not an option. Everyone should use their common sense.
quotes.Title: Dutch Driver
quotes.Name: Jos Verstappen

quotes.Text: Being signed to a major label was never an option because I knew having the time to find out who you are without pressure from other people is so important.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Freya Ridings

quotes.Text: I grew up with an incredibly loving and supportive family that gave me the impression there were a lot of options for me out there.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Esperanza Spalding

quotes.Text: Even if you're happy with the life you've chosen, you're still curious about the other options.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Taylor Swift

quotes.Text: For me, it is always important that I go through all the possible options for a decision.
quotes.Title: German Statesman
quotes.Name: Angela Merkel

quotes.Text: It's an infinite creative universe to explore so why chase conservative options?
quotes.Title: Australian Director
quotes.Name: Yahoo Serious

quotes.Text: We must have options to make tennis more attractive emotions-wise.
quotes.Title: French Coach
quotes.Name: Patrick Mouratoglou

quotes.Text: Respect for the rule of law is not optional; it's fundamental.
quotes.Title: Dutch Politician
quotes.Name: Frans Timmermans

quotes.Text: In life, we should explore options outside our comfort zone.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Athlete
quotes.Name: Dani Alves
